intro: Antonina debilis, commonly known as the weak antonina, is a delicate flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features soft, hairy leaves and produces small, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a lesser-known but ecologically significant species.
